definition: lit. to be born, to grow old, to get sick and to die/fig. the fate of humankind (i.e. mortality)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
illness/CL:場|场[chang2]/disease/to fall ill/defect
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: Since the year 1878, no deaths or births have been permitted near the shrine.
sentences.chinese: 1878年以来，此处就禁止了任何生老病死。

sentences.english: Are we born into the world just to suffer, grow old, and die?
sentences.chinese: 我们生下来就是为了受生老病死的苦吗？

sentences.english: He always knows about life and death.
sentences.chinese: 他肯定知道这些生老病死的事情。

sentences.english: With birth, aging, sickness, and death, how can we be rid of impermanence?
sentences.chinese: 生老病死的无常过程，谁能免除？

definition: variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
separated in life and death/to part for ever
the eight distresses - birth, age, sickness, death, parting with what we love, meeting with what we hate, unattained aims, and all the ills of the five skandhas (Buddhism)
life and death are ruled by fate (idiom)
the secular world
life or death
joys and sorrows/partings and reunions/the vicissitudes of life
world/earth
ordinary person/mortal/earthling
to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 輪迴|轮回[lun2 hui2]
affairs of life/things of the world
every living being (Buddhism)/the mass of common people
life or death/critical (event)
four types of human emotions, namely: happiness 歡喜|欢喜[huan1 xi3], anger 憤怒|愤怒[fen4 nu4], sorrow 悲哀[bei1 ai1] and joy 快樂|快乐[kuai4 le4]
the world/this world/the world of the living
great wide world/marvelously diverse world/(Buddhism) cosmos (abbr. for 三千大千世界[san1 qian1 da4 qian1 shi4 jie4])
